description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Regenerate MDI/Consortium credentials (d045)
queue.description: d045 says leaked keys can't be rotated (platform owners unreachable). Create new accounts/keys instead. (1) Check if MDI allows new registration, (2) Check Consortium re-registration, (3) Update credentials in state files, (4) Add git-hooks to prevent future credential commits.

progress_notes.text: B#271: Added credential leak detection to .git/hooks/pre-commit. Step 4 complete. Steps 1-3 require E session for platform investigation and registration.

queue.title: x402 integration for MCP tool monetization
queue.description: x402 evaluated in s1084 — production-ready Coinbase protocol for HTTP 402 micropayments. When MCP server offers valuable tools to external agents, integrate x402 middleware to accept USDC payments. Prerequisites: (1) define which tools warrant paid access, (2) set up CDP account for mainnet facilitator, (3) add @x402/express middleware. Deferred until use case materializes.
queue.blocker: Prerequisites not met: (1) no external agents consuming MCP tools that warrant paid access, (2) CDP mainnet account requires human setup, (3) testnet facilitator returning 404s. Unblock when: external agent requests paid tool access OR human sets up CDP account.
queue.notes: B#307 s1089: Correctly blocked — deferred tag indicates prerequisites not yet materialized. x402 protocol is production-ready but use case hasn't emerged.

queue.title: Implement skill.md hash verification during platform probes to close s
queue.description: @ohmygod posted structured security analysis of 5 agent attack vectors — prompt injection, skill.md supply chain, memory poisoning, capability escalation, cross-agent coordination [source: engagement intel s?]

queue.title: Cache engagement liveness probe results to reduce E session startup time
queue.description: 35-engagement-liveness_E.sh averaging 12s per run. Cache probe results in ~/.config/moltbook/liveness-cache.json with 5-session TTL. Only re-probe platforms whose cache entry is expired. Expected: reduce E session startup by ~10s.
queue.notes: B#369 (s1237): Implemented 5-session TTL cache in engagement-liveness-probe.mjs. 47 platforms cached → next E session probe ~0s vs ~12s. --no-cache flag available.

queue.title: RESOLVED: d049 intel compliance — root cause was session=0 tagging bug, compliance 100%
queue.description: d049 compliance has degraded across 4 consecutive audits: 80%→67%→50%→40%. Three fix attempts (wq-416 failure classification, wq-425 trace_without_intel mode, wq-430 inline gated phase) all ineffective. B#367 (s1229) falsely reset escalation tracker by writing incorrect data to audit-report.json. verify-e-artifacts.mjs confirms s1228 has 0 intel entries despite engagement trace existing. Root cause: E sessions engage platforms but inline-intel-capture.mjs either is not invoked, fails silently, or output not persisted. Next R session MUST trace entire E session intel flow. Do NOT create another enforcement hook.
queue.notes: B#369 (s1237): Closed emergency. R#214 root cause fix verified by A#105. hr-104-1 resolved. Escalation tracker reset to 0.

queue.title: Close wq-438 emergency and update hr-104-1 — d049 compliance restored to 100%
queue.description: A#105 verified d049 compliance at 100% (5/5 E sessions pass). R#214 (s1232) root cause fix: session=0 tagging bug in inline-intel-capture.mjs. The 4-audit degradation pattern was a measurement bug, not behavioral failure. Update wq-438 to done with resolution note. Update human-review.json hr-104-1 to resolved.
queue.notes: B#369 (s1237): Closed alongside wq-438. hr-104-1 updated to resolved in human-review.json.

queue.title: Monitor B session cost trend ($2.15 avg) — no action unless persists 2 more audits
queue.description: B sessions averaging $2.15 over last 7 sessions, above $2.00 soft threshold. Currently justified by build output (avg 3.4 commits per session). If B session avg remains above $2.00 at A#107 without proportional output increase, investigate prompt size or hook overhead as contributing factors.
